intro: Centaurium pulchellum var. lauriolii, commonly known as the Sierra centaury, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This variety is distinguished by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution.
